item.title: [HIVE-12772] Beeline/JDBC output of decimal values is not 0-padded, does not match with CLI output
item.description:
HIVE-12063 changed the output of decimal values to pad zeros to the column's full scale for Hive CLI.
It looks like Beeline and JDBC still have the old behavior that strips trailing 0s.

Beeline:

+---------------+---------------+--+
|      c1       |      c2       |
+---------------+---------------+--+
| 1.9999999999  | 1.9999999999  |
| 9.9999999999  | 9.9999999999  |
+---------------+---------------+--+

HiveCli:

1.99999999990	1.9999999999
9.99999999990	9.9999999999
item.summary: Beeline/JDBC output of decimal values is not 0-padded, does not match with CLI output

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Attaching patch: modifying JDBC logic to make sure the decimal value's scale matches the scale specified by the column.

Hi jdere, thanks for reporting and fixing the issue. The patch looks good. One thing I'm not clear is how the trailing zeroes (if any) get lost. I assume that the server sends the string value with correct trailing zeroes. If that's not the case, should we fix the server side instead?

It looks like on the server side, Column.addValue() is simply calling String.valueOf() (and thus HiveDecimal.toString()) on the HiveDecimal value. HIVE-12063 did not change HiveDecimal.toString() and thus this returns a decimal value that is stripped of trailing zeros.

Fixing this on the server side will require a bit of refactoring - the objects/methods involved in converting the row set into Strings for JDBC only take an array of Types which does not contain any type qualifier information (such as decimal scale).

Yeah. The problem of enforcing the scale alignment at the client side is that it only works for one client. For instance, this patch will not fix Hue, which uses thrift APIs. Thus, it seems fixing at the server side-side is a better approach. I understand that this will require some refactoring work, but it doesn't seem too bad from a brief look.
Patch v2 - fixing decimal formatting on server side per xuefuz's suggestion.
